scenes.background: (Monica) looks up from her notes, glancing at you. (Bob) is still typing on his laptop.
scenes.description: 'So, if more clarity on roles is needed, how should we start addressing that?'

options.text: We could outline everyone's responsibilities in a shared document and review it monthly.
options.analysis: You suggested a practical solution to improve clarity, showing good perception and social skills, though your motivation and self-regulation were moderate.

options.text: I'm not sure if writing it down will solve the issue. We might need more direct communication.
options.analysis: You expressed skepticism about a written approach, advocating for direct communication. This showed strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.

options.text: Honestly, some people should already know their roles. We shouldn't have to spell it out for everyone.
options.analysis: Your response was somewhat passive-aggressive, indicating lower empathy and self-regulation, and it might strain relationships with colleagues.
